item.title: Report E-2025040504
item.description:
Report E-2025040504

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-18
  • City: WHEELING
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 18, 2025, two (2) 5-gallon bladders of UN3267 were punctured and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the site. The crew utilized soda ash and absorbents to remediate the trailer. All impacted materials and the damaged bladders were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.description:
Report X-2025041348

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-12
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE COMPANY (UPSCO)
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT 9:15 AM THE RMP ALERTED TO A LEAKING HAZMAT ON THE FLOOR OF THE ADDISON CENTER INFRONT OF THE OFFICE. WE ARRIVED TO FIND THE PACKAGE SITTING ON THE GROUND WITH ORRENTATION ARROWS FACING UP. THE BOX WAS LABELED AS A CORROSIVE LIQUID. IT CONTAINED 4 ONE GALLON BOTTLES.

item.title: Report X-2025041320
item.description:
Report X-2025041320

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-10
  • City: HODGKINS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER SENT TO LEAKING HAZMAT; USED DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET TO CONTAINERIZE THE LEAKING PACKAGE. PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. INFORMATION WAS COLLECTED ON ALL SIX SIDES OF PACKAGE, LIQUID WAS SOLIDIFIED, MATERIAL WAS MEASURED, PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP.

item.title: Report X-2025040969
item.description:
Report X-2025040969

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-09
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SUPERVISOR NOTIFIED RMP TO SEND A RESPONDER TO RESPOND TO A LEAKING HAZMAT INSIDE THE TRAILER. RESPONDER ARRVIED WITH FULL PPE ON, STOCKED SPILL CART, AND CURRENT DECISION TREE. RESPONDER NOTICED THAT THE LEAKING HAZMAT HAD A FLAMMABLE LIQUID LABEL. RESPONDER READ AND FOLLOWED CURRENT DECISION TREE, WHICH LED THEM TO THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET. SINCE THERE WAS NO OUTSIDE SPILLAGE OF THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT PACKAGE, NO ZEP ZORBENT WAS NEEDED. RESPONDER SUCCESSFULLY CONTAINED THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT PACKAGE IN A SPILL TUB AND HEADED BACK TO THE PSC CAGE. RESPONDER READ AND FOLLOWED CURRENT DISPOSAL FLOW CHART, WHICH LED THEM TO THE DMP PROCEDURE. RESPONDER STARTED PROCESSING THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT PACKAGE AND SOLIDIFIED ALL CONTENTS INTO GREEN BAGS. RESPONDER THEN DECONTAMINATED ALL PPE.

item.title: Report E-2025040341
item.description:
Report E-2025040341

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-12T03:42:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-17
  • City: BRIDGEVIEW
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1828 ERTS was notified by of XPO Logistics of a 1 cup release of BRAKE AND PARTS CLEANER from 2-5gal metal pails on the dock. The cause was due to a forklift accident. ERTS reviewed the SDS with terminal personnel who feel comfortable cleaning the release with proper PPE. Terminal personnel will place the waste into a 35gal metal drum in the facilities waste area. ERTS will update Titan and upload the SDS and waste label. As per the BOL, Chemtrec was notified Chelsey issued report 2025031700148.
